definition[0]: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, make decisions etc
example[0]: a congress of the ruling Labor Party
definition[1]: the group of people chosen or elected to make the laws in some countries
definition[2]: used in the names of political parties
definition[3]: the group of people elected to make laws in the US, consisting of the Senate and the House of Representatives
example[2]: The president has lost the support of Congress.
definition[4]: a formal meeting of representatives of different groups, countries etc, to discuss ideas, give information, and make decisions
example[3]: the annual congress of the miners’ union
example[4]: The law was drafted by the Paraguayan military in 1991 and approved by the Congress.
example[5]: The President had lost the support of Congress.
